channel.title: Kaggle on Blackburn Theme Demo

item.title: Making COVID-19 interactive maps by piggybacking on John Hopkins University (Part 1)
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic has, in many ways, cast a spotlight on the need for reliable data to track and minimize the loss of human life. Among the many datasets and reports made available in recent months, this author’s work caught my attention. While their work is thorough and, in my opinion, well-written, it’s difficult to digest due to its volume. I recently came across an example making geographic data interactive using R and Plotly and thought: what if I combined these to make one compact visual, as opposed to several across multiple pages?
